New Records: Shubman Gill became the fifth Indian to have scored hundreds in all three international formats.
India's margin of victory - 168 runs - was the highest in any T20I involving two Full-Member teams.
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya took 4 wickets for 16 runs.
India bowled New Zealand out for 66.
Umran Malik took 2 wickets for 9 runs.
Shivam Mavi took 2 wickets for 12 runs.
Arshdeep Singh took 2 wickets for 16 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Hardik Pandya decided to bat first because the ball moved around more in the night.
Post-Match Reflections: The come-from-behind series win meant India maintained their unbeaten series record in all formats at home since March 2019.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand got immediate results with the decision of opening the bowling with Michael Bracewell through the wicket of Ishan Kishan.
Rahul Tripathi's all-out intent allowed Gill to take his time in the middle overs.
Daryl Mitchell bowled an excellent last over to concede just six runs.
